questions.text: When you create a fill-in-the-blank question, you must include every possible variety of capitalization of the answer in your answers. For example, if the answer is 'cat', you must have 'Cat', 'cat' and 'CAT'.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Quizzyland answers are NOT case sensitive!

questions.text: What is the number one reason that Quizzyland editors reject quizzes?
questions.explanation:
Incorrect grammar, spelling and punctuation.

	If you play all of the quizzes in this category, hopefully your quiz won't be rejected!

questions.text: You have a desire to create an original quiz; one that isn't like anything else in Quizzyland. On what topic could you write?
questions.explanation:
Breeds of pigs.

	For every truly original quiz we receive, we are deluged with dozens of quizzes on the same few topics. We love originality!

questions.text: Your quiz is rejected with a note to check your grammar, punctuation and spelling. Which of the following is NOT an appropriate response?
questions.correct: Give it a brief look-over and resubmit it- it's the editor's job to correct the mistakes
options: Have a teacher look it over
Copy it into a word processor to check for errors
questions.explanation:
Give it a brief look-over and resubmit it- it's the editor's job to correct the mistakes.

	Unfortunately, when we send quizzes back for correction, we rarely get them back corrected! If you know that your spelling skills are poor, please write your quiz in a word processor and spell-check it first!

questions.text: Quizzyland editors are paid for their services.
questions.explanation:
False.

	All Quizzyland editors are volunteers. Although many spend several hours a day editing quizzes, none are paid. Many of us edit 20-40 quizzes a day - that's why we like error-free quizzes!
